userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Preferred citation: [Identification of item], Richard Royden Turner Correspondence, WLU Coll. 0227, Special Collections, Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA.
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections staff to verify the appropriate format.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Claude P. Smith.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Blue sheet prepared by Susan L. Gates (2/20/89)

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard Turner was a member of the Washington and Lee University Class of 1896. He was a native of Ohio and returned there to work in the public school system. Later he moved to Oregon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is a personal letter to Master W. O. Bickle of Staunton. Topics mentioned are football, school food, and Thanksgiving break.
